text: Gordian I (;Encyclopaedia Britannica http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/239047/Gordian-II 159 â€“ 12 April 238) was a Roman Emperor. He was only emperor for one month, alongside his son Gordian II in 238, the Year of the Six Emperors. He was involved in a rebellion against the Emperor Maximinus Thrax. His armies were defeated by those loyal to Maximinus. Gordian then killed himself. == References == Category:159 births Category:238 deaths Category:3rd-century Roman emperors Category:Suicides
title: Gordian I
